standard_metadata.standard_description: Draw points, lines, line segments, rays, angles (right, acute, obtuse), and perpendicular and parallel lines. Identify these in two-dimensional figures.

question.content: **Which of these figures shows parallel lines?**

images.alt: Two lines that meet at right angles.
Two lines that are the same distance apart from each other and will never intersect.
Two lines that intersect each other.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\text{Parallel lines}}$ are always the same distance apart from each other — no matter how far we extend them, they will never meet.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines that are the same distance apart from each other and will never intersect.

hints.content: Which figure shows *parallel lines*?
This figure shows *parallel* lines:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines that are the same distance apart from each other and will never intersect.

The figure shows **perpendicular lines**.

question.content: **Which term describes the figure?**

images.alt: Two lines that intersect each other. One line extends from between 5 and 6 o'clock to between 11 and 12 o'clock. Another line extends from between 6 and 7 o'clock to between 12 and 1 o'clock.

options.content: Parallel lines
Perpendicular lines

hints.content: $\purpleD{\text{Parallel lines}}$ are always the same distance apart from each other — no matter how far we extend them, they will never meet.   [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenD{\text{Perpendicular lines}}$ are lines that meet at right angles.     [[☃ image 2]]

Two lines that meet at right angles.

The figure does **not** show parallel lines or perpendicular lines.  The answer is none of the above.

question.content: Look at the map below, then answer the question based on the appearance of the lines on the map.   **Which statement about Main Street and Pine Street is correct? **

images.alt: A street map. Holly Street and Pine Street are the same distance apart from each other and will never meet. Main Street intersects both Holly Street and Pine Street at an angle to both. Alta Street intersects Holly Street and Pine Street at right angles to both.

options.content: Main Street is parallel to Pine Street.
Main Street is perpendicular to Pine Street.
Main Street is neither parallel nor perpendicular to Pine Street.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\text{Parallel lines}}$ are always the same distance apart from each other — no matter how far we extend them, they will never meet.  [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenE{\text{Perpendicular lines}}$ are lines that meet at right angles.      [[☃ image 2]]  We can compare these to the lines formed by Main Street and Pine Street.

images.alt: Two lines that are the same distance apart from each other and will never intersect.
Two lines that meet at right angles.

hints.content: Looking at the map, we can see that Main Street and Pine Street intersect, or meet at an angle.   Parallel lines never meet, no matter how far we extend them, so the two streets are **not** parallel.     [[☃ image 1]]  We can also see that Main Street and Pine Street do **not** meet at a right angle, so the two streets are not perpendicular.

images.alt: A street map. Holly Street and Pine Street are the same distance apart from each other and will never meet. Main Street intersects both Holly Street and Pine Street at an angle to both. Alta Street intersects Holly Street and Pine Street at right angles to both. A line runs along Main Street. Another line runs along Pine Street. The two lines intersect at an angle.

hints.content: Main Street is neither parallel nor perpendicular to Pine Street.

question.content: Look at the map below, then answer the question based on the appearance of the lines on the map.   **Which statement about $2\text{nd}$ Street and Market Street is correct? **

images.alt: A street map. 1st Street and 2nd Street are the same distance apart from each other and will never meet. King Street intersects both 1st Street and 2nd Street at an angle to both. Market Street intersects 1st Street and 2nd Street at right angles to both.

options.content: $2\text{nd}$ Street is parallel to Market Street.
$2\text{nd}$ Street is perpendicular to Market Street.
$2\text{nd}$ Street is neither parallel nor perpendicular to Market Street.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\text{Parallel lines}}$ are always the same distance apart from each other — no matter how far we extend them, they will never meet.  [[☃ image 1]]   $\greenE{\text{Perpendicular lines}}$ are lines that meet at right angles.    [[☃ image 2]]  We can compare these to the lines formed by $2\text{nd}$ Street and Market Street.

images.alt: Two lines are the same distance apart from each other and will never intersect.
Two lines that meet at right angles.

hints.content: Looking at the map, we can see that $2\text{nd}$ Street and Market Street intersect, or meet at a right angle.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A street map. 1st Street and 2nd Street are the same distance apart from each other and will never meet. King Street intersects both 1st Street and 2nd Street at an angle to both. Market Street intersects 1st Street and 2nd Street at right angles to both. A line runs along 2nd Street. Another line runs along Market Street. The two lines intersect at a right angle.

hints.content: $2\text{nd}$ Street is perpendicular to Market Street.

question.content: Look at the map below, then answer the question based on the appearance of the lines on the map.   **Which statement about Robin Street and Owl Street is correct? **

images.alt: A street map. Robin Street and Owl Street are the same distance apart from each other and will never meet. Dove Street intersects both Robin Street and Owl Street at an angle to both. Red Street intersects Robin Street and Owl Street at an angle to both.

options.content: Robin Street is parallel to Owl Street.
Robin Street is perpendicular to Owl Street.
Robin Street is neither parallel nor perpendicular to Owl Street.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\text{Parallel lines}}$ are always the same distance apart from each other — no matter how far we extend them, they will never meet.   [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenE{\text{Perpendicular lines}}$ are lines that meet at right angles.     [[☃ image 2]]  We can compare these to the lines formed by Robin Street and Owl Street.

images.alt: Two lines that are the same distance apart from each other and will never intersect.
Two lines that meet at right angles.

hints.content: Looking at the map, we can see that Robin Street and Owl Street are always the same distance apart from each other — no matter how far we extend them, they will never meet.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A street map. Robin Street and Owl Street are the same distance apart from each other and will never meet. Dove Street intersects both Robin Street and Owl Street at an angle to both. Red Street intersects Robin Street and Owl Street at an angle to both. A line runs along Robin Street. Another line runs along Owl Street. The two lines never meet.

hints.content: Robin Street is parallel to Owl Street.

question.content: Look at the flag of Trinidad and Tobago below, then answer the question based on the appearance of the lines on the flag.   **Which statement about the two white stripes in the flag of Trinidad and Tobago is correct? **

images.alt: The Trinidad and Tobago flag is red with a thick diagonal black stripe between two thin diagonal white stripes. Two white stripes are the same distance apart from each other and will never meet.

options.content: The white stripes are parallel to each other.
The white stripes are perpendicular to each other.
The white stripes are neither parallel nor perpendicular to each other.

hints.content: Below are examples of $\greenC{\text{a pair of perpendicular lines}}$ and $\purpleC{\text{a pair of parallel lines}}$.     [[☃ image 1]]    [[☃ image 2]]  We can compare these to the white stripes in the flag of Trinidad and Tobago.

images.alt: Two lines that meet at right angles.
Two lines that are the same distance apart from each other and will never intersect.

hints.content: Looking at the flag, we can see that the white stripes do not meet to form angles.   Perpendicular lines meet to form $90^\circ$ angles, so the white stripes are **not** perpendicular.      [[☃ image 1]]  We can also see that the white stripes are always the same distance apart and do not meet.

images.alt: The Trinidad and Tobago flag is red with a thick diagonal black stripe between two thin diagonal white stripes. Two white stripes are the same distance apart from each other and will never meet. Each white stripe has a line with arrows placed on top of it.

hints.content: The white stripes in the flag of Trinidad and Tobago are parallel to each other.

question.content: Look at the flag of Aruba below, then answer the question based on the appearance of the lines on the flag.   **Which statement about the two yellow stripes in the flag of Aruba is correct? **

images.alt: The Aruba flag is blue with a red 4-point star outlined in white in the top left corner. Two yellow lines near the bottom are the same distance apart from each other and will never meet.

options.content: The yellow stripes are parallel to each other.
The yellow stripes are perpendicular to each other.
The yellow stripes are neither parallel nor perpendicular to each other.

hints.content: Below are examples of $\greenC{\text{a pair of perpendicular lines}}$ and $\purpleC{\text{a pair of parallel lines}}$.    [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ image 2]]   We can compare these to the yellow stripes in the flag of Aruba.

images.alt: Two lines that meet at right angles.
Two lines are the same distance apart from each other and will never intersect.

hints.content: Looking at the flag, we can see that the yellow stripes do not meet to form angles.   Perpendicular lines meet to form $90^\circ$ angles, so the yellow stripes are **not** perpendicular.   [[☃ image 1]]    We can also see that the yellow stripes are always the same distance apart and do not meet.

images.alt: The Aruba flag is blue with a red 4-point star outlined in white in the top left corner. Two yellow lines near the bottom are the same distance apart from each other and will never meet. Each line has a double-headed arrow placed on top of it.

hints.content: The yellow stripes in the flag of Aruba are parallel to each other.

question.content: Look at the flag of Sweden below, then answer the question based on the appearance of the lines on the flag.   **Which statement about the two yellow stripes in the Swedish flag is correct? **

images.alt: The flag of Sweden is blue with a yellow cross formed by two stripes. A vertical yellow stripe intersects with a horizontal yellow stripe at a right angle.

options.content: The two yellow stripes in the Swedish flag are parallel to each other.
The two yellow stripes in the Swedish flag are perpendicular to each other.
The two yellow stripes in the Swedish flag are neither parallel nor perpendicular to each other.

hints.content: Below are examples of $\greenC{\text{a pair of perpendicular lines}}$ and $\purpleC{\text{a pair of parallel lines}}$.     [[☃ image 1]]    [[☃ image 2]]  We can compare these to the yellow stripes in the flag of Sweden.

images.alt: Two lines that meet at right angles.
Two lines that are the same distance apart from each other and will never intersect.

hints.content: Looking at the flag, we can see that the yellow stripes intersect.   Parallel lines never meet, no matter how far they are extended, so the two yellow stripes are **not** parallel.     [[☃ image 1]]  We can also see that the yellow stripes meet at $90^\circ$ angles.

images.alt: The flag of Sweden is blue with a yellow cross formed by two stripes. A vertical yellow stripe intersects with a horizontal yellow stripe at a right angle. Each yellow stripe has a line with arrows placed on top of it.

hints.content: The two yellow stripes in the Swedish flag are perpendicular to each other.
